200.description: Service is ready to handle requests

500.description: Service is not ready to handle requests

req.name: consistency_level
req.description: Consistency level to check. Defaults to LOCAL_QUORUM.

req.name: rf_per_dc
req.description: Replication factor per datacenter. Defaults to 3.

200.description: Cassandra is able to achieve the specified consistency

500.description: Cassandra is unable to achieve the specified consistency

[-8842966077830801609, -7599446072150209: 2 replicas required, but only 1 nodes in the ring
[-7599446072150209635, -6632081829071674: 2 replicas required, but only 1 nodes in the ring

200.description: List of new seeds after reload

req.name: job_id
req.description: Job ID

req.name: force
req.description: Force decommission the node (true to force decommission, false to attempt graceful decommission).

500.description: Internal server error. For NoNodeAvailableException or ConnectionClosedException the response body is the literal message "Internal connection to Cassandra closed". For other errors the response body contains the exception's localized message.

req.name: value
req.description: MB/s throughput cap for compaction; set to 0 to disable throttling.

req.name: address
req.description: Address of the node to forcefully remove. This parameter is required; the server returns 400 if missing or blank.

400.description: Cassandra node assasination request missing address

req.name: target
req.description: The component or class to set the log level for. If omitted or blank, the logging configuration will be reset to the initial configuration.

req.name: rawLevel
req.description: The log level threshold to set (for example: DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR). If omitted or blank, the logging configuration will be reset to the initial configuration.

500.description: Internal server error (e.g. "Internal connection to Cassandra closed" when the connection to Cassandra is lost, or other server error message)

req.name: host
req.description: Host endpoint to truncate hints for. If omitted or blank, truncates all hints on the local node.

req.name: takeSnapshotRequest
req.description: TakeSnapshotRequest JSON payload

examples.text/plain: When specifying keyspace_tables, specifying keyspaces is not allowed

req.name: snapshotNames
req.description: Filter results by snapshot name(s). Multiple values can be provided by repeating this query parameter.

req.name: keyspaces
req.description: Filter results by keyspace name(s). Multiple values can be provided by repeating this query parameter.

req.name: repairRequest
req.description: Repair request payload

req.name: enabled
req.description: Whether to enable (true) or disable (false) full query logging

500.description: Internal Server Error (e.g. "Internal connection to Cassandra closed" or other exception message)

req.name: newToken
req.description: The new token to assign to the node on the token ring. This parameter is required.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node move request

500.description: Internal server error (connection to Cassandra closed or other server error)

examples.text/plain: The profile query parameter is required, try /api/v0/lifecycle/configure?profile=<profile>

req.name: profile
req.description: Optional profile name. When provided, Management API will use /tmp/{profile} configuration and env.sh for startup.

req.name: replace_ip
req.description: Optional IPv4 address to set -Dcassandra.replace_address_first_boot. If provided, it must match an IPv4 pattern.

202.description: Cassandra already running and can connect

204.description: Cassandra already running but can't connect

206.description: Cassandra process not found but can connect

req.name: compactRequest
req.description: CompactRequest payload

examples.text/plain: Invalid option combination: Can not use split-output here

req.name: tombstoneOption
req.description: Tombstone option, either 'ROW' or 'CELL'. Defaults to 'ROW' if not provided.

req.name: keyspaceRequest
req.description: Request body containing keyspace name, tables and jobs.

examples.text/plain: tombstoneOption must be either ROW or CELL

req.name: body
req.description: KeyspaceRequest payload

examples.text/plain: List tables failed. Non-empty 'keyspaceName' must be provided

req.name: body
req.description: CreateTableRequest payload

keyspace_name.description: Name of the existing keyspace in which to create the table

table_name.description: Name of the table to create

kind.description: Column kind (partition key, clustering column, regular, or static)

position.description: Position index for partition key or clustering column

options.description: Optional map of table options. Values may be strings or maps of string->string (e.g., complex options).

examples.text/plain: Table creation failed: some failure message

req.name: keyspaceRequest
req.description: Keyspace cleanup request

200.description: Job ID for keyspace cleanup process. (Note: some no-op branches may return the string "OK".)

req.name: keyspaceName
req.description: Name of the keyspace. This query parameter is required.

req.name: table
req.description: Name of the table. This query parameter is required.

400.description: Keyspace name or Table name not provided
Keyspace name or Replication Settings not provided

examples.text/plain: Keyspace creation failed. Non-empty 'keyspace_name' must be provided

req.name: createOrAlterKeyspaceRequest
req.description: Request body to alter the replication settings of an existing keyspace

400.description: Keyspace name or Replication Settings not provided

examples.text/plain: Altering Keyspace failed. Non-empty 'keyspace_name' must be provided

req.name: keyspaceName
req.description: Name of the keyspace to filter results. If provided (non-blank), only the matching keyspace is returned; if omitted or blank, all keyspaces are returned.

req.name: keyspaceName
req.description: Name of the keyspace to retrieve replication settings for. Non-empty 'keyspaceName' must be provided.

examples.text/plain: Get keyspace replication failed. Non-empty 'keyspaceName' must be provided
Get keyspace replication failed. Keyspace 'my_keyspace' does not exist.

req.name: force
req.description: Force decommission. When true, forces decommission; defaults to false if omitted.

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node decommission request

req.name: src_dc
req.description: Source datacenter to stream data from when rebuilding the node (optional).

202.description: Job ID for successfully scheduled Cassandra node rebuild request

200.description: Gets the schema versions for each node. Useful for checking schema agreement

202.description: Job ID for table scrub process

req.name: excludeCurrentVersion
req.description: If true, exclude tables already at the current sstable version from the upgrade. Optional; defaults to false when omitted.

req.name: keyspaceRequest
req.description: Request body containing keyspace and table selection and job count

jobs.description: Number of concurrent jobs (the implementation treats 0 as 1)

202.description: Job ID for keyspace SSTable upgrade process

req.description: Request body for compaction operation

202.description: Job ID for keyspace compaction process
